0P00001AX4.HK.long_name: Allianz Global Investors Choice Fund - Allianz Choice Hong Kong Fund Ordinary B
0P00001AX4.HK.summary: The Fundâs investment objective is to achieve long term capital growth by investing all its assets in an APIF, RCM Hong Kong Fund, a sub-fund of RCM Choice Fund, which aims to achieve long term capital growth by investing primarily in Hong Kong equities, including Chinese securities listed in Hong Kong.

0P00002C4X.HK.short_name: BOCHK Hong Kong Equity A HKD
0P00002C4X.HK.long_name: BOCHK Hong Kong Equity A HKD
0P00002C4X.HK.summary: The fund aims to provide investors with long term capital growth through investment mainly in the listed equities and equity related securities(including warrants and convertible securities) of companies operating principally in Hong Kong, or linked either directly or indirectly to Hong Kong economy.
0P00002C4X.HK.manager_bio: Tong is an analyst and portfolio manager with Hamon Investment Group. Since joining Hamon in 1995, her focus has been on the markets of Hong Kong, China and Taiwan, and she is responsible for Hamon's stock selection in these markets, as well as for managing several corporate and individual portfolios. Prior to joining Hamon, Tong worked for a Swiss private bank and Merrill Lynch Pierce Fenner & Smith.

0P00008ST5.HK.long_name: BOC-Prudential Easy-Choice MPF Scheme-BOC-Prudential Hong Kong Equity Fund
0P00008ST5.HK.summary: The BOC-Prudential Hong Kong Equity Fund is an equity fund which aims to provide investors with long-term capital growth by investing primarily in the Hong Kong equity sub-funds of BOC-Prudential Unit Trust Fund. Under normal circumstances, the sub-fund will invest mainly in the listed equity securities of companies operating in Hong Kong, or linked either directly or indirectly to Hong Kong economy, where appropriate, cash, time deposits, money market or fixed income securities may be considered. The risk profile of the BOC-Prudential Hong Kong Equity Fund is generally regarded as high.

0P00008SU1.HK.long_name: Hang Seng Mandatory Provident Fund-SuperTrust Plus-HSI Tracking Fund
0P00008SU1.HK.summary: The investment objective of the Hang Seng Index Tracking Fund is to match as closely as practicable the performance of the Hang Seng Index by investing directly in an approved ITCIS with a similar investment objective or investing indirectly in an approved ITCIS with a similar investment objective through a pooled investment fund.

0P00008SU2.HK.long_name: Hang Seng Mandatory Provident Fund-SuperTrust Plus-Hong Kong and Chinese Equity Fund
0P00008SU2.HK.summary: The investment objective of the Guaranteed Fund is to achieve long-term capital growth through a pooled investment fund that indirectly invests in portfolios of carefully selected securities listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, which may comprise of those Hong Kong listed Chinese equities (including H shares, red-chips and securities issued by companies deriving a preponderant part of their income and / or assets from China) and other securities listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. A portion of the investment portfolio indirectly held by this Fund may hold securities issued by companies deriving a preponderant part of their income and / or assets from Hong Kong and / or China that are listed on other stock exchanges. For the purpose of the investment objectives of the Hong Kong and Chinese Equity Fund, China means the Peopleâs Republic of China, excludes Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan.

0P0000GF57.HK.summary: The objective of the Fund is to achieve capital growth over the long-term by investing mainly in Hong Kong equity markets.

0P0000MPRM.HK.summary:
The objective of the Fund is to provide investment results that closely correspond to the performance of Hang Seng Index.

However where appropriate, the Trust may invest in Australian equity related securities including convertible notes, options, futures, derivatives and other related financial instruments.

0P0000WAH7.HK.long_name: Manulife Global Select (MPF) Scheme-Manulife MPF Hang Seng Index Tracking Fund
0P0000WAH7.HK.summary: The Hang Seng Index Tracking Fund is a unitised equity fund of the Scheme which is designed to provide medium to long term capital growth for members who hold a longer term investment view and who are prepared to accept significant fluctuations in the value of their investments in order to achieve long term returns.
0P0000WAH7.HK.manager_bio: Fong is the chief investment officer of SGAM Singapore.

0P0000YWUM.HK.long_name: CUAM China-Hong Kong Strategy Fund I
0P0000YWUM.HK.summary: CUAM China-Hong Kong Strategy Fund seeks to achieve medium to long-term capital growth, using bottom-up research approach to invest in a portfolio of equity securities issued by companies which are established in Greater China or derive the majority of their revenue from business or operations relating to Greater China ("Greater China Companies"). Business or operations relating to Greater China include, but are not limited to, direct investment in Greater China or trade involving Greater China.
0P0000YWUM.HK.family: China Universal Asset Management (Hong Kong) Company Limited

0P00014GQQ.HK.summary: "BOCIP Hong Kong Value Fund seeks to provide investors with long term capital growth by investing primarily in equity securities listed or to be listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited(""SEHK"") (including H shares, shares of red-chip companies, shares of other companies, exchange traded funds (âETFsâ) (including ETFs managed by the Manager) and real estate investment trusts (âREITsâ) listed on the SEHK) or listed equities issued by companies which have business or operations or interests in Hong Kong. 0P00017UW3.HK.long_name: BOCIP Hong Kong Low Volatility Equity Fund A
0P00017UW3.HK.summary:
"BOCIP Hong Kong Low Volatility Equity Fund seeks to provide investors with medium-term capital growth by investing primarily in equity securities listed or to be listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited (âSEHKâ), including H shares, red-chip companies, exchange traded funds (âETFsâ) (including ETFs managed by the Manager) and real estate investment trusts (âREITsâ). 
The Manager will invest at least 70% of the Fundâs non-cash assets in equity securities, ETF and REITs so as to achieve the investment objectives of the Fund. Cash or deposits may be considered when appropriate. 
BOCIP Hong Kong Low Volatility Equity Fund seeks to achieve a reduced level of volatility against the broad market. Stock selection is based on identifying stocks with lower volatility and other characteristics based on the Managerâs internal selection process. The Fund has no specific industry focus. The Fund will consider investment opportunities in all market capitalization ranges."
